subject.normal: Kernel Upgrade on 7.2 with ext3 file system

headers.subject: Re: Kernel Upgrade on 7.2 with ext3 file system
headers.received: (from mail@localhost) by mail.redhat.com (8.11.0/8.8.7) id f9NKHWW20140 for redhat-list@listman.redhat.com; Tue, 23 Oct 2001 16:17:32 -0400
headers.x-warning-1: Spammers extracting addresses from this message will definitely want to include the following addresses:

body.para: On Tue, 23 Oct 2001, rpjday posted the following:

r>On Tue, 23 Oct 2001, Jeff Lane wrote: r> r>> Not to add a me-too, but I had no problems either. However, I didnt r>> exactly upgrade my kernel. I started with the 2.4.7 from Roswell2, adn r>> then upgraded to the kernel.org 2.4.10. (I normally keep known working r>> kernels, and my systems usually end up with 5 different bootable kernels.) r>> r>> The only thing I am missing is ext3 support under 2.4.10, but that is r>> because I didnt patch the kernel to include it.... however, since I am r>> using ext3 on this machine, the 2.4.10 kernel will mount all the r>> filesystems as ext2 with no problems at all. (other than the annoying r>> failed messages at boot that say module ext3 doesnt exisit). r>> r>> cheers r>> r>> On Tue, 23 Oct 2001, Kandy Danner wrote: r>> r>> > r>> > I was wondering if anyone has successfully done a 2.4.10 kernel upgrade r>> > on 7.2 with an ext3 filesystem. r> r>by the way, the patch is at www.uow.edu.au/~andrewm/linux/ext3. you r>should apply the appropriate patch to a pristine version of the 2.4.10 r>kernel source.
All of the ac patches have the ext3 code built in...
- -- csm Free Dmitry! Boycott Adobe! Repeal the DMCA! Stop the SSSCA! -----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE----- Version: GnuPG v1.0.6 (GNU/Linux) Comment: For info see http://www.gnupg.org
